result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Eric S Holtzman was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The fine is $2072.00 to be paid as condition of probation.

DNA surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as condition of probation.

DNA sample to be submitted.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  Good time allowed.  Court will allow monitoring by Sun Monitoring in Iowa if approved by jail.

records.addlTxt: Two discharge certificates filed by DOC
Defendant discharged from probation on 7-29-19 with no unpaid financial obligations

09:33 AM Defendant, Eric S Holtzman, appeared by phone. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant had requested early termination of probation. State did not receive any paperwork except for the courts response requsting paperwork from the agent. State objected with argument. Court denied the request. 9:40 AM

records.addlTxt: Of John Postle Sr with Sun Monitoring.
Filed by defendant/counsel.
Filed by defendant/counsel.

10:08am/10:25am Defendant Eric S Holtzman in court with attorney Michele Tjader.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty  to count 1: OWI-4th.  Court adjudged guilty of count 1.  Court will dismiss count 2 and 15TR200 & 15TR326R.  Court imposes on count 1: sentence withheld 3 years probation w conds: 6 months conditional jail w huber-good time -court will allow monitoring by Sun Monitoring in Iowa if approved by jail, , $2072.00, 36 month revocation & IID, AODA & treatment, DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge, maintain absolute sobriety.  2 days jail credit.   Report time will be 1:00 pm. today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 08:45 am.

from Atty. Tjader requesting today's pretrial be removed from calendar (ADA Cross unable to attend - conflict), as well as 2-18-16 jury trial; defense to file motions by the end of the week, and request motion hearing be set - fax

ct 2:  BAC 4th

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not operate motor vehicle at all.   Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption.  Defendant may leave state of WI to travel home to Iowa.  Not to travel anywhere but to his residence and court.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.

Defendant Eric S Holtzman by video, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not operate motor vehicle at all.   Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption.  Defendant may leave state of WI to travel home to Iowa.  Not to travel anywhere but to his residence and court.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:50 pm.  Hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
